+1
 
Never did like having all that clutter.
 
- Kris

-----Original Messag=
e-----
From: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:archive-crawler@yahoog=
roups.com] On Behalf Of stack
Sent: 3. ma=ED 2005 15:41
To: archive-crawler=
@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [archive-crawler] Proposal: Move unit tests to ow=
n directory.


In Heritrix, unit tests sit beside the classes tested though=
 the common 
practise is to keep tests apart from the runtime src, in a dir=
ectory of 
tests only.  The original rationale for putting tests beside the=
 classes 
tested was to avoid having to look in two places for code and as =
a 
constant in-the-developers'-face reminder that tests need to be written.=


Recently Christian Kohlsch=FCtter proposed Heritrix do as other projects =

do and move unit tests to their own directory.  In the main Christian 
arg=
ues a src tree polluted by tests is tough to grok and that as tests 
prolif=
erate and become more involved -- if we start adding mock objects 
and test=
 data -- apprehension of Heritrix workings will get harder with 
time.  His=
 argument in full can be viewed here: 
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index=
.php?func=3Ddetail
<http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=3Ddetail&=
aid=3D1187976&group_id=3D7
3833&atid=3D539102.> &aid=3D1187976&group_id=3D7=
3833&atid=3D539102.

What do others think?

(How about an apache-like +1 if=
 you agree that tests should be moved, -1 
if you disagree, and 0 if neutra=
l.  Let majority carry the motion, 
unless a minority puts up a good fight)=
.

Yours,
St.Ack
